a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Various measures of national saving/investment compared to GDP per
GDP (gross domestic product) represents a nation's total income. The rest of the variables are various measures of national
saving and investment, or in other words, changes in total wealth.
Note: Measured in 1990 international dollars. In order of increasing comprehensiveness, these measures include: Net investment = net
fixed produced capital formation and overseas investment; Green investment = Net investment + change in natural capital; Genuine
savings = Green investment + education expenditure; GSTFP = Genuine savings + Net present value of total factor productivity (i.e.
